article_title: Thailand Losing Out on Conferences in Wake of Protests, Coup
article_text:
BANGKOK—Months of raucous street demonstrations—culminating in Thursday's military coup—are walloping an important sector of Thailand's travel industry: the meetings and conferences business.

Thailand is one of the world's most visited destinations, with tourism contributing some 9% of the country's gross domestic product. Travel known by the acronym MICE—meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions—produced some 88 billion Thai...
